segments.text: I see the water pouring over the sink, and it’s making me feel a little disgusted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron is going to get soaked, and she doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, taking cookies while she’s distracted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool like it’s nothing, and it’s making me cringe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie, like this is all fine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how messy and careless everyone is being right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just going to ruin the cabinets, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone should really clean this up before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just a mess, and it’s making me feel a little sick.
segments.speaker: PAR
